titles.title: A Hundred Thousand Souls A Day (easy morbid)

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}They're passing passing Fast away in thousands day by day They're passing to their doom They're passing to their doom{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}A hundred thousand souls a day Are passing one by one away In Christ-less guilt and gloom Without one ray of hope or light With future dark as endless night They're passing to their doom They're passing to their doom{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}O Holy Ghost Thy people move Baptize their hearts with faith and love And consecrate their gold At Jesus' feet their millions pour And all their ranks unite once more As in the days of old As in the days of old{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The master's coming draweth near The Son of Man will soon appear His kingdom is at hand But ere that glorious day can be This gospel of the kingdom we Must preach in every land Must preach in every land{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Oh let us then His coming haste Oh let us end this awful waste Of souls that never die For many millions still are lost A Savior's blood has paid the cost Oh hear their dying cry Oh hear their dying cry{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Armies of pray'r your promise claim Prove the full pow'r of Jesus' name And take the victory Your conq'ring Captain leads you on The glorious fight may still be won This very century This very century{/lang-eng}
